title: Drawing, "Numa Pompilius Worshipping Jove on the Aventine, Ceiling Design for the Sala di Numa Pompilius, Palazzo Milzetti, Faenza", 1804–05
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash over black chalk on white laid paper
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and brown ink, lower center: numa adora Giove sul monte/ Aventino
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Jupiter, seated upon clouds before slope, extends right hand over Numa who kneels in magic circle. Eagle stands beside Jove, rural gods Pius and Faunus converse in left middle distance. Pitchers from which Numa poured wine into brook  beside him; brook runs in right foreground.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Numa Pompilius Worshipping Jove on the Aventine, Ceiling Design for the Sala di Numa Pompilius, Palazzo Milzetti, Faenza", 1804–05.
1804–05. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash over black chalk on white laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-3452.
